metadata.title: CVE-2018-10932 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
lldptool version 1.0.1 and older can print a raw, unsanitized attackercontrolled buffer when mngAddr information is displayed. This may allow anattacker to inject shell control characters into the buffer and impact thebehavior of the terminal.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10932` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lldpad - 1.0.1+git20180808.4e642bd-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lldpad package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.1+git20180808.4e642bd-1').
